availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
State and Commonwealth of Kentucky
City Court of Louisville
The Commonwealth of Kentucky to the Marshal of the City Court of Louisville
Greeting

Whereas I have this day received information on oath from Christian Quisnot, that in said City, in the month of February 1865, a number of steael springs a quantity of Iron, and a number of iron axles, ^of the value of fifty dollars^ were feloniously stolen taken and carried away, out of the possession of said Quisnot, being his property, and that he has probable cause to suspect and does suspect that said springs, iron and axles so stolen taken and carried away, by William and Louis Kyner. Contrary to the Statute in case made and provided

These are therefor to command you forthwith to arrest said Whalen and Kyner and bring them before the Judge of our said Court at the Court house thereof, in said City, to be dealt with according to Law, and have you then there this writ
Witness my hand this 11th day of March 1865
Phil Tomppert Jr Clk City Ct L

Affiants William Hipwell & Thomas Garrity Policemen in the city of Louisville Ky state upon oath that they are acquainted with William Whalen and Louis Kyner referred to in the above
warrant and that -- the same parties are now charged in the said city court with having committed a Felony in this county and that said charge can be easily sustained; That defendants in the above charge are common theives & have heretofore escaped for want of legal proof & when an attempt was made to arrest said parties on the above charge they ran off in great haste & escaped to Nashville Tennessee
Subscribed and sworn to before me by Wm Hipwell & Thomas Garretty This 13th day of Mach 1865
Jos Clement Justice of the peace Jeff Co ky

Requisition Gov Tennessee. issued 14th Mch 1865
Commonwealth
vs } Grand Larceny
Wm Whalen
Louis Kyner
Wm Hipwell & Thos Garrity
apptd
agents
